column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////As good as the food is
column2: the Sodikoff experience pays equal parts tribute to the grandeur of dining
column3: and Bavette's is no different. Note that coming by a reservation is about as difficult as not encountering a wait at Au Cheval. We managed to snag a 5:15-er
column5: the place was packed. Good luck there. If you can get it
column7: you're treated to that rich mahogany fine dining experience without the pretension to back it up. One of the coolest things (of which we did not partake
column8: preferring to stick to cocktails) about Bavette's is its hidden corkage fee. You can BYOB
column9: with the only stipulation that you share a glass with another table. It's that kind of cool.
